meanings.definition: To praise too much or excessively.
meanings.sent1: She kept overpraising his mediocre artwork, making him feel embarrassed.
meanings.sent2: It's not good to overpraise someone all the time; they might not believe your compliments.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's constant overpraising of the student's simple drawings made the class giggle.
meanings.sent4: Her friends accused her of overpraising the new restaurant, claiming it was just average.
meanings.sent5: The coach's habit of overpraising every player, regardless of their performance, led to a lack of motivation.

meanings.definition: The act of praising someone or something too much.
meanings.sent1: His overpraising of the singer's talent made others question his judgment.
meanings.sent2: Overpraising can sometimes lead to unrealistic expectations and disappointment.
meanings.sent3: The overpraising of the cake's taste by the guests made the baker blush.
meanings.sent4: The politician's overpraising of his own achievements raised suspicion among the voters.
meanings.sent5: The overpraising of the movie's plot by critics left the audience underwhelmed.
